meanings.definition: Ready to conform to the authority or will of others.
meanings.sent1: Her submissiveness nature made her a good team player.
meanings.sent2: The dog's submissiveness to its owner was evident in its wagging tail.
meanings.sent3: The robot's submissiveness to commands was both impressive and slightly unnerving.
meanings.sent4: The submissiveness of the waves to the pull of the moon was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The submissiveness of the student to the teacher's instructions ensured a harmonious classroom.

meanings.definition: Showing a willingness to yield or surrender to the will of others.
meanings.sent1: His submissiveness attitude in negotiations often led to successful compromises.
meanings.sent2: The cat's submissiveness towards the new kitten surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The submissiveness of the clouds to the wind's direction created ever-changing shapes in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The submissiveness of the branches to the weight of the snow resulted in a picturesque winter scene.
meanings.sent5: The submissiveness of the employee to feedback helped in personal growth and development.
